content: the back loop - continue knitting 3 more row bind off sew on button on last stripe to the right of sm2 steeking and fringe carefully cut between 10th and 11th stitch in steek panel your tube is now a rectangle carefully unravel stitches on each short side of rectangle because of the twisted stitch the fringe will only unravel the 10 stitches on each side steam block the ends so that they lose stitch memory and become straight knot each color to create a tassel if not doing stripes 10-12 strands per tassel enjoy if you would like video support for finishing steps there is one available here https //www youtube com/watch v=z6hq2gaippa a note about picking a size just a reminder large size wrap/scarf smaller still large size wrap/shawl what does this mean the large size is longer you can wear it buttoned with a triangle point in the front but the two points will likely not overlap the smaller size is shorter this makes it easier to have the two points overlap so it comes down to this want the points to overlap/worn as a triangle small size want a giant cozy wearable blanket large size 3
